question: [File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions()] [Integer Underflow] In the retry loop at lines 47-48, can an attacker cause checked_sub() to return None by manipulating elapsed time, causing the function to bail after limited retries and potentially causing loss of liveness during critical transaction emission periods? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions()] [Infinite Loop DoS] Does the retry loop starting at line 43 have proper bounds checking, or can it run indefinitely if Cluster::try_from_cluster_args() consistently fails, exhausting resources and causing validator slowdown? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions()] [Race Condition] Can concurrent calls to emit_transactions() with coordination_delay_between_instances create race conditions where multiple instances compute different remaining delays at line 47, leading to inconsistent transaction emission timing and potential mempool flooding? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions()] [Time Manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate system time to cause start_time.elapsed() at line 47 to return unexpected values, bypassing coordination delays and causing transaction storms that overwhelm the network? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions()] [Logic Error] At line 48, if coordination_delay_between_instances becomes None and i has reached a large value, does the bail! message at line 49 leak sensitive information about retry attempts that could help attackers time their attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions_with_cluster()] [Gas Price Bypass] At lines 137-139, can an attacker provide arbitrarily low gas_price values through args.gas_price to create transactions that validators will reject, causing wasted computation and potential DoS on the mempool? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions_with_cluster()] [Integer Overflow] Can args.max_gas_per_txn at lines 141-143 be set to values exceeding u64::MAX or blockchain gas limits, causing integer overflow in gas calculations and potential transaction rejection after expensive computation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions_with_cluster()] [Gas Calculation Bypass] At lines 145-147, can init_max_gas_per_txn be set higher than max_gas_per_txn, creating inconsistent gas limits that allow transactions to bypass gas restrictions during initialization phase? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions_with_cluster()] [Economic Attack] Can init_gas_price_multiplier at lines 149-151 be set to extreme values (e.g., 1000000x) to make initial account creation transactions economically infeasible, preventing legitimate users from creating accounts while draining the coin_source_account? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions_with_cluster()] [Inconsistent Gas Estimation] Between lines 153-165, if multiple expected_gas_* parameters are set with conflicting values (e.g., expected_gas_per_txn < expected_gas_per_transfer), can this cause incorrect balance calculations leading to insufficient funding and transaction failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions_with_cluster()] [Authentication Bypass] At lines 109-130, when keyless authentication is used, are the expect() calls at lines 116, 122, 128 safe, or can an attacker provide a keyless_ephem_secret_key without setting other required fields, causing panics that crash the transaction emitter? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions_with_cluster()] [Keyless Account Impersonation] Does the keyless account setup at lines 109-130 properly validate the JWT signature and expiry date, or can an attacker use expired or forged JWTs to create unauthorized keyless accounts and drain funds? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions_with_cluster()] [Proof File Manipulation] At lines 118-123, can an attacker provide a malicious proof_file_path pointing to a tampered proof file that passes validation but allows unauthorized account creation or transaction signing? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions_with_cluster()] [EPK Expiry Bypass] Can the epk_expiry_date_secs at lines 113-117 be set to values in the past or far future to bypass ephemeral key expiry checks, allowing long-lived keyless accounts that violate security assumptions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions_with_cluster()] [Funds Theft] At line 91, does load_coin_source_account() properly validate the loaded account's signature, or can an attacker replace the coin source account with their own account to redirect all funding transactions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions_with_cluster()] [Privilege Escalation] At lines 167-171, when coin_source_is_root is true, does set_mint_to_root() bypass normal account funding limits, potentially allowing unlimited minting if the root account is compromised? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions_with_cluster()] [Unauthorized Spending] At line 170, does prompt_before_spending() actually prevent spending, or is it just a UI prompt that can be bypassed by automated scripts to drain non-root coin sources without user consent? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions_with_cluster()] [Balance Override Bypass] At lines 177-179, can coins_per_account_override be set to 0 to skip funding checks while still creating accounts, leading to unfunded accounts that cannot perform transactions but pollute the state? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions_with_cluster()] [Funding Skip Exploit] At lines 186-188, when skip_funding_accounts is true, are accounts still created but unfunded, allowing an attacker to create millions of empty accounts that bloat the blockchain state without paying appropriate costs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions_with_cluster()] [Transaction Expiry Manipulation] At line 94, can args.txn_expiration_time_secs be set to extremely long values (e.g., years) to create transactions that remain valid indefinitely, enabling replay attacks after account state changes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions_with_cluster()] [Chain ID Spoofing] At line 93, does TransactionFactory use cluster.chain_id without validation, allowing an attacker to emit transactions for a different chain that might get included in the wrong network? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions_with_cluster()] [Gas Unit Price Bypass] At line 95, is aptos_global_constants::GAS_UNIT_PRICE hardcoded and immune to governance changes, potentially causing transaction rejection if the network updates gas prices through governance? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions_with_cluster()] [Weak RNG] At line 96, does StdRng::from_entropy() provide cryptographically secure randomness for account generation, or can an attacker predict the seed and front-run account creation to steal funds? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions_with_cluster()] [Biased Instance Selection] At line 90, does random_instance() select instances with uniform probability, or can it be biased toward specific validators that might be Byzantine nodes, concentrating transaction submission attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/transaction-emitter-lib/src/wrappers.rs] [Function: emit_transactions_with_cluster()] [Mempool Overflow] At line 87, can EmitJobMode::create() be configured with extreme mempool_backlog values that exhaust validator memory when combined with high target_tps, causing validator crashes?
